p: Impatiens glandulifera had a causal but low impact on the resident vegetation in both riparian habitats, alder forests and meadows. The effect could be seen already after one season, but may also intensify over longer time. Impatiens glandulifera had some characteristics of a back‐seat driver, which is facilitated by previous ecosystem changes but is also a driver of further changes having causal impact on the invaded ecosystem. If I. glandulifera has to be managed for nature conservation, this involves the need of ecosystem restoration along with removal of the invader.
